text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition ext-R5-EncounterHistory

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*ExtensionA record of significant events/milestones key data throughout the history of an Encounter
Slices for extension 2..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Closed by value:url
extension:encounter 0..1ExtensionThe Encounter associated with this set of historic values
value[x] 0..1Reference(Encounter)The Encounter associated with this set of historic values
extension:status ?!1..1Extensionplanned | in-progress | on-hold | discharged | completed | cancelled | discontinued | entered-in-error | unknown
value[x] 0..1codeplanned | in-progress | on-hold | discharged | completed | cancelled | discontinued | entered-in-error | unknown
Binding: Cross-version VS for R5.EncounterStatus for use in FHIR R4 (required): Current state of the encounter.
extension:class 1..1ExtensionClassification of patient encounter
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptClassification of patient encounter
Binding: ActEncounterCode (extensible): Classification of the encounter.
extension:type 0..*ExtensionSpecific type of encounter
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptSpecific type of encounter
Binding: EncounterType (example): A specific code indicating type of service provided
extension:serviceType 0..*ExtensionSpecific type of service
Slices for extension Content/Rules for all slices
extension:_datatype 0..1(Complex)Data type name for EncounterHistory.serviceType from FHIR R5
URL: http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/_datatype
value[x] 1..1stringValue of extension
Fixed Value: CodeableReference
extension:concept 0..1ExtensionReference to a concept (by class)
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptReference to a concept (by class)
extension:reference 0..1ExtensionReference to a resource (by instance)
value[x] 0..1Reference()Reference to a resource (by instance)
extension:subjectStatus 0..1ExtensionThe current status of the subject in relation to the Encounter
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptThe current status of the subject in relation to the Encounter
Binding: encounter-subject-status (??) (example): Current status of the subject within the encounter.
extension:actualPeriod 0..1ExtensionThe actual start and end time associated with this set of values associated with the encounter
value[x] 0..1PeriodThe actual start and end time associated with this set of values associated with the encounter
extension:plannedStartDate 0..1ExtensionThe planned start date/time (or admission date) of the encounter
value[x] 0..1dateTimeThe planned start date/time (or admission date) of the encounter
extension:plannedEndDate 0..1ExtensionThe planned end date/time (or discharge date) of the encounter
value[x] 0..1dateTimeThe planned end date/time (or discharge date) of the encounter
extension:length 0..1ExtensionActual quantity of time the encounter lasted (less time absent)
value[x] 0..1DurationActual quantity of time the encounter lasted (less time absent)
extension:location 0..*ExtensionLocation of the patient at this point in the encounter
Slices for extension 1..*ExtensionExtension
Slice: Unordered, Closed by value:url
extension:location 1..1ExtensionLocation the encounter takes place
value[x] 0..1Reference(Location)Location the encounter takes place
extension:form 0..1ExtensionThe physical type of the location (usually the level in the location hierarchy - bed, room, ward, virtual etc.)
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptThe physical type of the location (usually the level in the location hierarchy - bed, room, ward, virtual etc.)
Binding: location-form (??) (example): Physical form of the location.
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/5.0/StructureDefinition/extension-EncounterHistory"

Documentation for this format

name: ext_R5_EncounterHistory
title: Cross-version Extension for R5.EncounterHistory for use in FHIR R4
description: This cross-version extension represents EncounterHistory from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/EncounterHistory|5.0.0 for use in FHIR R4.

element.short: A record of significant events/milestones key data throughout the history of an Encounter
element.definition: A record of significant events/milestones key data throughout the history of an Encounter, often tracked for specific purposes such as billing.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: The current status of the subject in relation to the Encounter
element.definition: The subjectStatus value can be used to track the patient's status within the encounter. It details whether the patient has arrived or departed, has been triaged or is currently in a waiting status.

element.short: Actual quantity of time the encounter lasted (less time absent)

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension

element.short: A record of significant events/milestones key data throughout the history of an Encounter
element.definition: A record of significant events/milestones key data throughout the history of an Encounter, often tracked for specific purposes such as billing.

element.short: The Encounter associated with this set of historic values
The Encounter associated with this set of historic values
planned | in-progress | on-hold | discharged | completed | cancelled | discontinued | entered-in-error | unknown
element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because it is a status element that contains status entered-in-error which means that the resource should not be treated as valid

element.short: planned | in-progress | on-hold | discharged | completed | cancelled | discontinued | entered-in-error | unknown

element.definition: Concepts representing classification of patient encounter such as ambulatory (outpatient), inpatient, emergency, home health or others due to local variations.
Concepts representing classification of patient encounter such as ambulatory (outpatient), inpatient, emergency, home health or others due to local variations.
Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation).

binding.description: A specific code indicating type of service provided

element.definition: Broad categorization of the service that is to be provided (e.g. cardiology).

element.definition: Data type name for EncounterHistory.serviceType from FHIR R5

element.comment: Must be: CodeableReference

element.short: The current status of the subject in relation to the Encounter
element.definition: The subjectStatus value can be used to track the patient's status within the encounter. It details whether the patient has arrived or departed, has been triaged or is currently in a waiting status.

binding.description: Current status of the subject  within the encounter.

element.short: The actual start and end time associated with this set of values associated with the encounter
element.definition: The start and end time associated with this set of values associated with the encounter, may be different to the planned times for various reasons.

element.short: The planned start date/time (or admission date) of the encounter
The planned start date/time (or admission date) of the encounter
The planned end date/time (or discharge date) of the encounter
The planned end date/time (or discharge date) of the encounter
Actual quantity of time the encounter lasted (less time absent)
element.definition: Actual quantity of time the encounter lasted. This excludes the time during leaves of absence.When missing it is the time in between the start and end values.

element.short: Location of the patient at this point in the encounter
element.definition: The location of the patient at this point in the encounter, the multiple cardinality permits de-normalizing the levels of the location hierarchy, such as site/ward/room/bed.
The location where the encounter takes place.
The location where the encounter takes place.

element.short: The physical type of the location (usually the level in the location hierarchy - bed, room, ward, virtual etc.)
element.definition: This will be used to specify the required levels (bed/ward/room/etc.) desired to be recorded to simplify either messaging or query.
